            <p>Except as otherwise noted, our prices are exclusive of applicable taxes and duties, including VAT and applicable sales tax.             <script id="element-83c5fd57-39ac-46aa-ab7e-e89f9eda975c-controls" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
  <div class="aws-dropdown-wrapper lb-dropdown">
    <label>{{loc-message "Region:"}}</label>
    <ul class="button lb-dropdown-label" role="listbox" tabindex="0">

           </div> 
           <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
            <p>Except as otherwise noted, our prices are exclusive of applicable taxes and duties, including VAT and applicable sales tax. For customers with a Japanese billing address, use of AWS is subject to Japanese Consumption Tax. <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/c-tax-faqs/">Learn more</a>.</p> 
           </div> 
          </div> </li> 
        </ul> 
       </div> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>Pricing is per instance-hour consumed for each instance, from the time an instance is launched until it is terminated or stopped. Each partial instance-hour consumed will be billed per-second for Linux Instances and as a full hour for all other instance types.</p> 
        <p>The vCPU number is the default and maximum number of vCPUs available for the specified EC2 instance type. You can specify a custom number of vCPUs when launching this instance type. Instance pricing will remain same as displayed above. For more details on valid vCPU counts and how to start using this feature, visit the Optimize CPUs documentation page <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/instance-optimize-cpu.html" target="_blank">here</a>.</p> 
        <p>Looking for T1, M1, C1, CC2, M2, CR1, CG1, I2, HS1, M3, C3, or R3 instances? See the <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/previous-generation/">Previous Generation Instances</a> page.<br> </p> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="Data_Transfer" class="lb-txt-none lb-h2 lb-title"> Data Transfer</h2> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>The pricing below is based on data transferred "in" to and "out" of Amazon EC2.</p> 
       </div> 
       <script id="element-e85833ab-3c12-492e-834e-20bb04b19494-content" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
  <p><div class="aws-controls"><div class="aws-dropdown-wrapper lb-dropdown"><label>{{loc-message "Region:"}}</label><ul class="button lb-dropdown-label" role="listbox" tabindex="0">{{#each regions}}<li data-region="{{this}}" role="option" tabindex="0">{{loc-message this}}</li>{{/each}}</ul></div></div></p>
<table>
<thead>
<tr><th></th><th>Pricing</th></tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr><td><strong>Data Transfer IN To Amazon EC2 From Internet</strong></td><td></td></tr>
{{#if datatransfer/datatransfer.[DataTransfer External Inbound]}}<tr><td>All data transfer in</td><td><span data-metered-unit="datatransfer/datatransfer.[DataTransfer External Inbound]" {{#if datatransfer/datatransfer.[DataTransfer External Inbound]}}data-rate-code="{{datatransfer/datatransfer.[DataTransfer External Inbound].rateCode}}">{{loc-currency datatransfer/datatransfer.[DataTransfer External Inbound].[price]}}{{else}}>{{loc-message "N/A"}}{{/if}}</span> per GB</td></tr>{{/if}}
<tr><td><strong>Data Transfer OUT From Amazon EC2 To Internet</strong></td><td></td></tr>

</table>
</div> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>If the Data Transfer per month is greater than 500 TB / month, please <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/contact-us/aws-sales/">contact us</a>.</p> 
        <p>Rate tiers take into account your aggregate usage for Data Transfer Out to the Internet across Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, Amazon Glacier, Amazon RDS, Amazon Redshift, Amazon SageMaker, Amazon SES, Amazon SimpleDB, Amazon SQS, Amazon SNS, Amazon DynamoDB, AWS Storage Gateway, and Amazon CloudWatch Logs.<br> </p> 
       </div> 
       <h4 id="Data_Transfer_within_the_same_AWS_Region" class="lb-txt-none lb-txt-16 lb-h4 lb-title"> Data Transfer within the same AWS Region</h4> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>Data transferred "in" to and "out" from Amazon EC2, Amazon RDS, Amazon Redshift , Amazon DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX), and Amazon ElastiCache instances or Elastic Network Interfaces across Availability Zones or VPC Peering connections in the same AWS Region is charged at $0.01/GB in each direction.</p> 
        <p>IPv4: Data transferred in to and out from public or Elastic IPv4 address is charged at $0.01/GB in each direction.<br> IPv6: Data transferred in to and out from an IPv6 address in a different VPC is charged at $0.01/GB in each direction.</p> 
        <p>Data transferred between Amazon EC2, Amazon RDS, Amazon Redshift, Amazon ElastiCache instances and Elastic Network Interfaces in the same Availability Zone is free. See above when transferring data using VPC peering.</p> 
        <p>Data transferred between Amazon S3, Amazon Glacier, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon SES, Amazon SQS, Amazon Kinesis, Amazon ECR, Amazon SNS or Amazon SimpleDB and Amazon EC2 instances in the same AWS Region is free. AWS Services accessed via PrivateLink endpoints will incur standard PrivateLink charges as explained <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/pricing/">here</a>.</p> 
        <p>Data transferred "in" to and "out" from Amazon Classic and Application Elastic Load Balancers using private IP addresses, between EC2 instances and the load balancer in the same AWS Region is free.<br> </p> 
       </div> 
       <hr class="lb-divider"> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>Except as otherwise noted, our prices are exclusive of applicable taxes and duties, including VAT and applicable sales tax. For customers with a Japanese billing address, use of AWS is subject to Japanese Consumption Tax. <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/c-tax-faqs/">Learn more</a>.<br> </p> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="EBS-Optimized_Instances" class="lb-txt-none lb-h2 lb-title"> EBS-Optimized Instances</h2> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>EBS-optimized instances enable EC2 instances to fully use the IOPS provisioned on an EBS volume. EBS-optimized instances deliver dedicated throughput between Amazon EC2 and Amazon EBS, with options between 500 and 4,000 Megabits per second (Mbps) depending on the instance type used. The dedicated throughput minimizes contention between Amazon EBS I/O and other traffic from your EC2 instance, providing the best performance for your EBS volumes. EBS-optimized instances are designed for use with both Standard and Provisioned IOPS Amazon EBS volumes. When attached to EBS-optimized instances, Provisioned IOPS volumes can achieve single digit millisecond latencies and are designed to deliver within 10% of the provisioned IOPS performance 99.9% of the time.</p> 
        <p>For Current Generation Instance types, EBS-optimization is enabled by default at no additional cost. For Previous Generation Instances types, EBS-optimization prices are on the Previous Generation Pricing Page.</p> 
        <p>The hourly price for EBS-optimized instances is in addition to the hourly usage fee for supported instance types.<br> </p> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="Elastic_IP_Addresses" class="lb-txt-none lb-h2 lb-title"> Elastic IP Addresses</h2> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>You can have one Elastic IP (EIP) address associated with a running instance at no charge. If you associate additional EIPs with that instance, you will be charged for each additional EIP associated with that instance per hour on a pro rata basis. Additional EIPs are only available in Amazon VPC.</p> 
        <p>To ensure efficient use of Elastic IP addresses, we impose a small hourly charge when these IP addresses are not associated with a running instance or when they are associated with a stopped instance or unattached network interface. There is no charge for Elastic IP addresses you create from an IP address prefix you brought into AWS using <a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ec2-byoip.html" target="_blank">Bring Your Own IP</a>.<br> </p> 
       </div> 
       <div class="aws-plc">

        <li data-region="ap-southeast-2" role="option" tabindex="0">Asia Pacific (Sydney)</li>
        <li data-region="ap-northeast-1" role="option" tabindex="0">Asia Pacific (Tokyo)</li>
        <li data-region="ca-central-1" role="option" tabindex="0">Canada (Central)</li>
        <li data-region="eu-central-1" role="option" tabindex="0">Europe (Frankfurt)</li>
        <li data-region="eu-west-1" role="option" tabindex="0">Europe (Ireland)</li>
        <li data-region="eu-west-2" role="option" tabindex="0">Europe (London)</li>
        <li data-region="eu-west-3" role="option" tabindex="0">Europe (Paris)</li>
        <li data-region="eu-north-1" role="option" tabindex="0" class="js-active">Europe (Stockholm)</li>
        <li data-region="sa-east-1" role="option" tabindex="0">South America (Sao Paulo)</li>
        <li data-region="us-gov-east-1" role="option" tabindex="0">AWS GovCloud (US-East)</li>
        <li data-region="us-gov-west-1" role="option" tabindex="0">AWS GovCloud (US-West)</li>
    </ul>
  </div></div> 
         <div class="aws-plc-content"><div data-region="us-east-2" class="">
  <ul>
        <li data-plc-offer-id="BEK3CSKSFCXH83SA.JRTCKXETXF.ETY2894C67">$0.00 per Elastic IP address remap for the first 100 remaps per month</li>
        <li data-plc-offer-id="BEK3CSKSFCXH83SA.JRTCKXETXF.JBQRCS5NHT">$0.10 per Elastic IP address remap for additional remaps over 100 per month</li>
    </ul>
  </div><div data-region="eu-north-1" class="js-active">
  <ul>
        <li data-plc-offer-id="3QP4V4UQS7KFSQC7.JRTCKXETXF.ETY2894C67">$0.00 per Elastic IP address remap for the first 100 remaps per month</li>
        <li data-plc-offer-id="3QP4V4UQS7KFSQC7.JRTCKXETXF.JBQRCS5NHT">$0.10 per Elastic IP address remap for additional remaps over 100 per month</li>
    </ul>
  </div></div> 
        </div> 
        <script id="element-4215de9e-f58c-4bef-b910-97ba1941fbf8-controls" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
  <div class="aws-dropdown-wrapper lb-dropdown">
    <label>{{loc-message "Region:"}}</label>
    <ul class="button lb-dropdown-label" role="listbox" tabindex="0">
      {{#each regions}}
        <li data-region="{{this}}" role="option" tabindex="0">{{loc-message this}}</li>
      {{/each}}
    </ul>
  </div>
</script> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="Carrier_IP_Addresses" class="lb-txt-none lb-h2 lb-title"> Carrier IP Addresses</h2> 
       <script id="element-2e12f0e9-1d89-49c7-8347-44a43c4ad037-content" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
  <p><div class="aws-controls"><div class="aws-dropdown-wrapper lb-dropdown"><label>{{loc-message "Region:"}}</label><ul class="button lb-dropdown-label" role="listbox" tabindex="0">{{#each regions}}<li data-region="{{this}}" role="option" tabindex="0">{{loc-message this}}</li>{{/each}}</ul></div></div></p>
<p>You can have one Carrier IP (CIP) address associated with a running instance in a Wavelength Zone at no charge. If you associate additional CIPs with that instance, you will be charged for each additional CIP associated with that instance per hour on a pro rata basis.</p>
<p>To ensure efficient use of Carrier IP addresses, we impose a small hourly charge when these IP addresses are not associated with a running instance or when they are associated with a stopped instance or unattached network interface.</p>
<ul>
{{#if ec2/carrierip.[Additional Carrier IP address attached to a running instance]}}<li><span data-metered-unit="ec2/carrierip.[Additional Carrier IP address attached to a running instance]" {{#if ec2/carrierip.[Additional Carrier IP address attached to a running instance]}}data-rate-code="{{ec2/carrierip.[Additional Carrier IP address attached to a running instance].rateCode}}">{{loc-currency ec2/carrierip.[Additional Carrier IP address attached to a running instance].[price]}}{{else}}>{{loc-message "N/A"}}{{/if}}</span> per additional IP address associated with a running instance per hour on a pro rata basis</li>{{/if}}
{{#if ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address attached to a running instance]}}<li><span data-metered-unit="ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address attached to a running instance]" {{#if ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address attached to a running instance]}}data-rate-code="{{ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address attached to a running instance].rateCode}}">{{loc-currency ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address attached to a running instance].[price]}}{{else}}>{{loc-message "N/A"}}{{/if}}</span> per Carrier IP address not associated with a running instance per hour on a pro rata basis</li>{{/if}}
{{#if ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap First 100 Free]}}<li><span data-metered-unit="ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap First 100 Free]" {{#if ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap First 100 Free]}}data-rate-code="{{ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap First 100 Free].rateCode}}">{{loc-currency ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap First 100 Free].[price]}}{{else}}>{{loc-message "N/A"}}{{/if}}</span> per Carrier IP address remap for the first 100 remaps per month</li>{{/if}}
{{#if ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap]}}<li><span data-metered-unit="ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap]" {{#if ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap]}}data-rate-code="{{ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap].rateCode}}">{{loc-currency ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap].[price]}}{{else}}>{{loc-message "N/A"}}{{/if}}</span> per Carrier IP address remap for additional remaps over 100 per month</li>{{/if}}
</ul>
</script> 
       <div id="element-2e12f0e9-1d89-49c7-8347-44a43c4ad037" class="aws-plc aws-plc-richtext aws-table" data-token-paths="[&quot;ec2/carrierip&quot;]" data-token-keys="[&quot;ec2/carrierip.[Additional Carrier IP address attached to a running instance]&quot;,&quot;ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap]&quot;,&quot;ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address attached to a running instance]&quot;,&quot;ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap First 100 Free]&quot;]" data-token-bjs="false" data-aws-partition="aws" data-no-region="[]" data-token-prefix="https://b0.p.awsstatic.com/pricing/2.0/meteredUnitMaps" data-when-not-available="visible" data-template="#element-2e12f0e9-1d89-49c7-8347-44a43c4ad037-content" data-lb-comp="plc:plc-setup" data-lb-comp-registered="true">
  <p></p><div class="aws-controls"><div class="aws-dropdown-wrapper lb-dropdown"><label>Region:</label><ul class="button lb-dropdown-label" role="listbox" tabindex="0"><li data-region="us-east-1-wl1-atl1" role="option" tabindex="0" class="js-active">US East (Verizon) - Atlanta</li><li data-region="us-east-1-wl1" role="option" tabindex="0">US East (Verizon) - Boston</li><li data-region="us-east-1-wl1-dfw1" role="option" tabindex="0">US East (Verizon) - Dallas</li><li data-region="us-east-1-wl1-mia1" role="option" tabindex="0">US East (Verizon) - Miami</li><li data-region="us-east-1-wl1-nyc1" role="option" tabindex="0">US East (Verizon) - New York</li><li data-region="us-east-1-wl1-was1" role="option" tabindex="0">US East (Verizon) - Washington DC</li><li data-region="us-west-2-wl1-den1" role="option" tabindex="0">US West (Verizon) - Denver</li><li data-region="us-west-2-wl1-las1" role="option" tabindex="0">US West (Verizon) - Las Vegas</li><li data-region="us-west-2-wl1" role="option" tabindex="0">US West (Verizon) - San Francisco Bay Area</li><li data-region="us-west-2-wl1-sea1" role="option" tabindex="0">US West (Verizon) - Seattle</li><li data-region="ap-northeast-1-wl1-nrt1" role="option" tabindex="0">Asia Pacific (KDDI) - Tokyo</li><li data-region="ap-northeast-2-wl1-cjj1" role="option" tabindex="0">Asia Pacific (SKT) - Daejeon</li></ul></div></div><p></p>
<p>You can have one Carrier IP (CIP) address associated with a running instance in a Wavelength Zone at no charge. If you associate additional CIPs with that instance, you will be charged for each additional CIP associated with that instance per hour on a pro rata basis.</p>
<p>To ensure efficient use of Carrier IP addresses, we impose a small hourly charge when these IP addresses are not associated with a running instance or when they are associated with a stopped instance or unattached network interface.</p>
<ul>
<li><span data-metered-unit="ec2/carrierip.[Additional Carrier IP address attached to a running instance]" data-rate-code="BTHNK5AAUH7Z8S4P.JRTCKXETXF.6YS6EN2CT7">$0.005</span> per additional IP address associated with a running instance per hour on a pro rata basis</li>
<li><span data-metered-unit="ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address attached to a running instance]" data-rate-code="3ZQ3YU2665GUSWDS.JRTCKXETXF.JTU8TKNAMW">$0.005</span> per Carrier IP address not associated with a running instance per hour on a pro rata basis</li>
<li><span data-metered-unit="ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap First 100 Free]" data-rate-code="6Z2ESTCNXG88275B.JRTCKXETXF.ETY2894C67">$0.00</span> per Carrier IP address remap for the first 100 remaps per month</li>
<li><span data-metered-unit="ec2/carrierip.[Carrier IP address remap]" data-rate-code="6Z2ESTCNXG88275B.JRTCKXETXF.JBQRCS5NHT">$0.10</span> per Carrier IP address remap for additional remaps over 100 per month</li>
</ul>
</div> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>Except as otherwise noted, our prices are exclusive of applicable taxes and duties, including VAT and applicable sales tax. For customers with a Japanese billing address, use of AWS is subject to Japanese Consumption Tax. <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/c-tax-faqs/">Learn more</a>.<br> </p> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="Elastic_Load_Balancing" class="lb-txt-none lb-h2 lb-title"> Elastic Load Balancing</h2> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>To see prices, visit the <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/">Elastic Load Balancing</a> page.<br> </p> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="On-Demand_Capacity_Reservations" class="lb-txt-none lb-h2 lb-title"> On-Demand Capacity Reservations</h2> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>On-Demand Capacity Reservations are priced exactly the same as their equivalent (On-Demand) instance usage. If a Capacity Reservation is fully utilized, you only pay for instance usage and nothing towards the Capacity Reservation. If a Capacity Reservation is partially utilized, you pay for the instance usage and for the unused portion of the Capacity Reservation. Learn more about On-Demand Capacity Reservations <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/faqs/#On-Demand_Capacity_Reservation">here</a>.<br> </p> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="T2.2FT3.2FT4g_Unlimited_Mode_Pricing" class="lb-txt-none lb-h2 lb-title"> T2/T3/T4g Unlimited Mode Pricing</h2> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>For T4g instances in Unlimited mode, CPU Credits are charged at $0.04 per vCPU-Hour for Linux, RHEL and SLES.&nbsp;</p> 
        <p>For T2 and T3 instances in Unlimited mode, CPU Credits are charged at:</p> 
        <ul> 
         <li>$0.05 per vCPU-Hour for Linux, RHEL and SLES, and</li> 
         <li>$0.096 per vCPU-Hour for Windows and Windows with SQL Web</li> 
        </ul> 
        <p>The CPU Credit pricing is the same for all instance sizes, for On-Demand, Spot, and Reserved Instances, and across all regions.</p> 
        <p>See <a href="http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/t2-unlimited.html" target="_blank">Unlimited Mode documentation</a> for details on when CPU Credits are charged.<br> </p> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="Amazon_CloudWatch" class="lb-txt-none lb-h2 lb-title"> Amazon CloudWatch</h2> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>To see prices, visit the <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/pricing/">Amazon Cloudwatch Pricing</a> page.<br> </p> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="Amazon_Elastic_Block_Store" class="lb-txt-none lb-h2 lb-title"> Amazon Elastic Block Store</h2> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>To learn more, visit the <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/ebs/pricing/">EBS Pricing Page</a>.<br> </p> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="Amazon_EC2_Auto_Scaling" class="lb-txt-none lb-h2 lb-title"> Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling</h2> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p>Auto Scaling is enabled by Amazon CloudWatch and carries no additional fees. Each instance launched by Auto Scaling is automatically enabled for monitoring and the applicable <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/">Amazon Cloudwatch</a> charges will be applied.<br> </p> 
       </div> 
       <h2 id="AWS_GovCloud_Region" class="lb-txt-none lb-h2 lb-title"> AWS GovCloud Region</h2> 
       <div class="lb-rtxt"> 
        <p><a href="https://aws.amazon.com/govcloud-us/">AWS GovCloud</a> is an AWS Region designed to allow U.S. government agencies and contractors to move more sensitive workloads into <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/what-is-cloud-computing/">the cloud</a> by addressing their specific regulatory and compliance requirements. For pricing and more information on the new AWS GovCloud Region, please visit the <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/govcloud-us/">AWS GovCloud Web Page</a>.</p> 
        <p><i>* Your usage for the Free Tier is calculated each month across all regions except the AWS GovCloud region, and automatically applied to your bill  unused monthly usage will not roll over. Does not include Amazon EC2 running IBM, or the AWS GovCloud Region. See <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/free/terms/">offer terms</a> for more details and other restrictions.<br> ** As part of AWSs Free Usage tier, new AWS customers will receive free 15 GB of data transfer out each month aggregated across all AWS services for one year except in the AWS GovCloud Region.<br> *** Rate tiers take into account your aggregate Data Transfer Out usage across Amazon EC2, Amazon EBS, Amazon S3, Amazon Glacier, Amazon RDS, Amazon SimpleDB, Amazon SQS, Amazon SNS, AWS Storage Gateway, Amazon DynamoDB, and Amazon VPC.</i></p> 
        <p><i>(Amazon EC2 is sold by Amazon Web Services, Inc.)</i></p> 
       </div> 
       <div class="lb-mid-pad lb-none-v-margin lb-grid" style="background-color:#f1f4f6;"> 
        <div class="lb-row lb-row-max-large lb-snap">

     </ul>
